intro: Stachyandra viticifolia, commonly known as the grape-leaved stachyandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often described as resembling grape leaves in shape. It produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Stachyandra viticifolia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforest understory.
